snippet.title: Q: Print Variable Array of Specific Worksheets to a Single Printout
snippet.description: from project to project. For example, In project #1 the workbook will include the following worksheets: "Recipe", "Pie \- Apple", "Pie \- Pumpkin", "Ingredients", and "Tools". In project #2 … PrintCollection PrintCollection = Array("Recipe", "Pie \- Apple", "Pie \- Pumpkin") ThisWorkbook.Worksheets(PrintCollection).PrintOut End Sub This code works; however, it requires me to manually enter …

snippet.title: A: You must publish at least one action to your Timeline using this action type
snippet.description: with an appropriate object instance via the action. POST /me/{namespace}:{action-type-name} The following call establishes a Cook connection between the current user and a Pumpkin Pie (an instance … of the Recipe object type): https://graph.facebook.com/me/recipebox:cook? recipe=http://www.example.com/pumpkinpie.html&access_token=YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN Here is another example using …

snippet.title: A: Table can't have 2-field primary key with auto_increment
snippet.description: =utf8; Let's add a record in the recipies table first INSERT INTO `recipies` (`name`,`category`) VALUES ('Pumpkin Pie','Pastry'); Then let's add a row INSERT INTO `instructions` (`recipeId … duplicate combination of these 2 fields. To be able to add multiple steps for a single recipe you will need to make sure none of recipeId, stepNumber or instruction is set to auto-increment. The only …
